column1: While we contemplate on these glooming prospects
column2: let us look at the bright side—up toward the sky. Every day
column3: the sun sends out an enormous amount of energy. The amount of solar energy reaching the surface of our planet is so vast that in 1 year it is about twice as much as will ever be obtained from all of the Earth's non-renewable resources of coal
column6: and mined uranium (for nuclear energy) combined. The sun provides more energy in about an hour than the world uses in one year! Furthermore
column7: the sun is free and does not belong to any one country. It is a local
column8: inexhaustible resource that is clean and sustainable.Tremendous effort is going into the development of means to capture the sun's energy
column9: with focus on various types of solar cells. The disadvantage of solar cells is that they provide energy in the form of electricity
column10: which cannot satisfy all of our society's energy needs.
